why was this treatise composed?
the answer is: in order to stop the tenets of others and reveal one's own meaning.
that is to say, some say:
there is no cultivation in the future.
one should not have what has not yet been done and yet already attained.
in order to block that attachment and reveal that there is cultivation in the future.
although it has not yet arisen, it has already arisen in that category.
or some say: two minds occur together.
because seeing, hearing, etc. exist simultaneously.
in order to block that attachment and reveal that there are not two minds occurring together.
because the rapid turning of moments is not simultaneous but seems simultaneous.
or some say:
the four right efforts, etc. are not used at the same time because the causes are different.
In order to refute this opinion, it is said that these four are simultaneous and have no separate substance.
Or, there is another opinion.
Faith, etc., are only pure.
Because a scripture says that ordinary beings do not have the faculties of faith, etc.
In order to refute this opinion, it is made clear that faith, etc., are common to both pure and impure.
Because a scripture only speaks of pure faculties.
Or, there is another opinion.
The faculties and powers have different substances.
Because they are distinguished by superiority and inferiority.
In order to refute this opinion, it is made clear that although there is a difference in status, the faculties and powers have the same substance and function.
Or, there is another opinion.ğŸ”½The factors of enlightenment are common to both pure and impure.
Because it is said that one cultivates the factor of enlightenment of mindfulness together with impurity.
In order to refute this opinion, it is made clear that the factors of enlightenment are only pure.
Because a scripture says that they are not simultaneous, but are simultaneous in the future.
Or, there is another opinion.
There is joy in the preliminary stages.
Because a scripture says that one cuts off joy and escapes sorrow based on joy.
In order to refute this opinion, it is made clear that the preliminary stages are without joy.
Because a scripture says that what has been cut off and what will be cut off is called cut off.
Or there are some who say:
Right speech, action, and livelihood do not exist simultaneously.
Because in one moment there is no second bodily or verbal [action].
In order to refute this view,
[the sÅ«tra] shows that the three kinds of precepts arise from the three faculties,
and can be obtained simultaneously.
Or there are some who say:
Stream-enterers and once-returners also attain meditative absorption.
In order to refute this view, [the sÅ«tra] shows that they do not attain [meditative absorption] because they have not yet separated from desire.
Or there are some who say:
Patience is precisely wisdom.
In order to refute this view, [the sÅ«tra] shows that patience is not wisdom,
because one has not yet ascertained the truth of the object.
Or there are some who say:
Ordinary beings do not eliminate afflictions because they have not yet seen the truth.
In order to refute this view, [the sÅ«tra] clarifies that ordinary beings also eliminate afflictions and see the gross [afflictions] and so forth.
Or there are some who say:
Noble ones do not eliminate afflictions through the worldly path.
In order to refute this view,
[the sÅ«tra] shows that noble ones are free and can use any path [to eliminate afflictions].
Or there are some who say:
The factor of right thought also exists in the upper [realms].
To refute this view, it is shown that those stages do not have those factors, because they are without initial thought.
Or, there may be the view
that the formless realm also has the factors of pure precepts.
To refute this view,
it is shown that they do not have precepts, because they are without form.
Or, there may be the view
that the three samÄdhis have different meanings but the same substance.
To refute this view,
it is clarified that their substances are also different, because their modes of activity and objects are different.
In order to stop these various heterodox tenets and to clarify what is correctly explained,
this treatise is composed.

Question: Just as the diamond-like concentration takes the four aggregates of the peak of existence as its object,

in this way, then the object
may be different.

Question: When the noble ones have already become free from the defilements of the third meditative absorption and have attained the fourth meditative absorption,
if they cultivate the supernormal power of spiritual penetrations based on the first meditative absorption,
in the uninterrupted path they should be said to cultivate four, namely the first meditative absorption and the future [meditative absorptions].
Because the uncontaminated supernormal power is cultivated based on the higher and lower [meditative absorptions], why is it only said to be one future [meditative absorption]?
Answer: Some say:
It should be said that they cultivate four future [meditative absorptions], but it is not said. One should know that there is more.
Some say:
Here it is said based on the gradual [approach].

Even if one becomes free from the defilements of the third meditative absorption,

one only cultivates one [meditative absorption] and does not cultivate the higher stages.
Question: Doesn't one based on the first meditative absorption eliminate the defilements of the higher stages,
and those who are post-learners?
When one cultivates the sharp faculties, does one also cultivate the merits of the upper stages?
It is said that one relying on the lower stages cannot cultivate the upper stages.
The answer is: One who can cultivate the upper stages can eliminate the passions of the upper stages.
This is because the antidote of the path of the lower stage is the same as that of the upper stage.
When one eliminates the passions by the Dharma, the antidote is necessarily cultivated.
The cultivation of sharp faculties by the post-learner is like the attainment of that fruit.
Therefore, all of these rely on the lower stages to cultivate the upper stages.
The supernormal powers are not like this, so one does not cultivate the upper stages.
Just as in the path of insight, one only cultivates the lower stages.
This example is unreasonable.
The path of insight is the first attainment of the spiritual family, and one is not yet master of it.
Therefore, one only cultivates what is of the same stage.
The path of cultivation is the attainment of the spiritual family.
Being master of it, why not also cultivate what is of the upper stages?
However, the five supernormal powers are superior merits.
When one cultivates the preparatory path, one must make the utmost effort.
If one has already attained mastery of the meditative absorptions, what principle would obstruct one from also cultivating what is of the upper stages?
From this one should understand that the former explanation is better.
The formless realms, etc., should be understood in the same way.

This then refutes the claim that there is no pure precepts in the formless realm,
and the claim that there is right thought in the upper stages.

Question: Just as there are no pure great elements,
but there are pure precepts,
in the same way, although there are no great elements of that stage,
there are precepts of that stage.
What fault is there in this?
Answer: Pure precepts do not fall into realms and stages.
They follow the great elements of the body on which they are based.
Because of this, although there are no pure great elements,
there are pure precepts that are produced.
Pure precepts definitely fall into realms and stages,
and are only produced from the great elements of one's own stage.
Because they have no great elements, precepts also do not exist.

Question: If pure precepts follow the great elements of the body on which they are based, when one is born in the desire or form realms and enters the pure formless concentrations, one should give rise to pure precepts concomitant with those concentrations, because there are great elements in the body on which they are based.
Answer: Although pure precepts are created by the primary elements that support the body,
they must be created by the primary elements of a certain stage.
Only then can pure precepts arise in accordance with that class.
In the formless realm, there are no primary elements to create pure precepts.
Therefore, pure precepts also do not exist there.
Because pure precepts are produced based on those [primary elements].
Question: Why is the substance of precepts only form?
Answer: Because it prevents the arising of evil form.
And because it is the nature of bodily and verbal actions.
Because bodily and verbal actions have form as their substance.
Question: Why is mental action not precepts?
Answer: Because it cannot directly prevent evil precepts.
Question: Why are evil precepts not mental actions?
Answer: Those who have not yet separated from desire
all possess unwholesome mental actions.
Would they all be called violators of precepts or those of poor discipline?
Therefore, evil precepts are not mental actions.
Moreover, if wholesome mental actions were wholesome precepts,
then all those who have not severed wholesomeness would be called abiding in discipline.
Because they all accomplish wholesome mental actions.
If you allow this,
then a single sentient being would be called abiding in moral discipline,
and also called abiding in immoral discipline.
Then there should be no three kinds of distinctions.
This would contradict the holy teachings, therefore
wholesome and unwholesome precepts are not mental actions.
Also, because the world commonly acknowledges restraining body and speech as precepts.
Mental actions are not precepts.
You should know that mental actions are the cause for giving rise to precepts.
The cause of precepts cannot be called precepts.
Do not allow the cause and effect to be mixed up and lost.
Therefore, the factors of the path in the formless realm are only four.
Because the future [factors] are cultivated in common with the lower uncontaminated [factors].
There are eight formless liberations.
The present [factors] are one.
That is, one of the three stages that were previously relied upon.
